H0.text: Who is said to have cut the Gordian Knot. Alexander the Great

H1.text: Who is said to have cut the Gordian Knot. Hercules

H2.text: Who is said to have cut the Gordian Knot. Perseus

H3.text: Who is said to have cut the Gordian Knot. Sikunder

A4.text: At the ancient Phrygian capital of Gordium, Alexander 'undid' the hitherto unsolvable Gordian Knot, a feat said to await the future 'king of Asia'. According to the story, Alexander proclaimed that it did not matter how the knot was undone, and hacked it apart with his sword.
